section.name: Role Administration Guide
section.p: Role Management is where you manage individual portal roles. You can create new roles and remove existing roles. You can assign users to roles. The Role Management page is located inside the Jetspeed Administrative Portlets section. The Role Management page is the second tab on the administrative menu across the top. Here you see the Role Admin on the left, and the Role Detail Information on the right.

section.name: Role Admin
section.p: The Role Admin portlet lists all portal roles and allows you to search for a particular role.
TODO: screenshot of complete role admin portlet

subsection.name: Paging
subsection.p: If there are more than ten roles in the system, the role listing is spread over several pages each displaying ten roles. You can navigate through the pages using the buttons right below the listing. Clicking on the "Refresh" button will reset the role listing to the first page.
TODO: screenshot of paging buttons

subsection.name: Searching
subsection.p: You can search for a particular role by entering the role name or part of the role name in the search text box. After clicking on the "Search" button, the role listing will show the search results, starting with the role that best matched your search query, followed by increasingly less matching roles.
TODO: screenshot of search text box and button

subsection.name: Filtering
subsection.p: To get only exact matches when searching for (or part of) a particular role name, check the "filter" checkbox below the search text box.
TODO: screenshot of the filter check box

section.name: Adding and Deleting Roles
section.p: The Role Detail Information portlet allows you to add and/or remove roles.

subsection.name: Adding a Role
subsection.p:
To add a role, depending on the Role Detail Information portlets state, you either need to...
enter a role name and press "Save", or
select "Add New Role", enter a role name and press "Save",

subsection.name: Removing a Role
subsection.p: To remove a role from the system, click on the desired role in the Role Admin portlet. A small arrow will appear in front of the role name to indicate it is currently selected, and the role's existing users will be loaded in the Role Details Information portlet. Click the "Remove Role" button. Be aware that this action is permanent!
TODO: screenshot of Remove Role button

section.name: Adding Users to Roles
section.p: To add or remove users assigned to a role, click on the role name in the Role Admin portlet. A small arrow will appear in front of the role name to indicate it is currently selected, and the role's existing users will be loaded in the Role Details Information portlet.
TODO: screenshot of role admin and role detail information portlet

subsection.name: Paging
subsection.p: If there are more than ten users assigned to a role in the system, the role listing is spread over several pages each displaying ten users. You can navigate through the pages using the buttons right below the listing. Clicking on the "Refresh" button will reset the user listing to the first page.
TODO: screenshot of paging buttons

subsection.name: Add Users to Role
subsection.p: The Role Detail Information portlet allows you to add users to a role. Select "Add Users to Role". A pop-up window will appear. Check the users you wish to add and click "Add Users". The Role Detail Information portlet will be populated with the selected users.
TODO: screenshot of the pop-up window

subsection.name: Remove Checked Users
subsection.p: To remove a user from a role, select the user(s) you wish to remove and click on the "Remove Checked Users" button. Be aware that this action is permanent!
TODO: screenshot of Remove Checked Users button

subsection.name: Search Users in Role
subsection.p: You can search for a particular user by entering the users name or part of the users name in the search text box. After clicking on the "Search" button, the "Users in Role" listing will show the search results, starting with the user that best matched your search query, followed by increasingly less matching users.
